channel.title: Prediction on Tyler Smith

item.title: Predicting Blood Donations
item.description: Purpose This post shows some basic R usage, data exploration, and prediction methods. Download data from website training_data_url <- "https://s3.amazonaws.com/drivendata/data/2/public/9db113a1-cdbe-4b1c-98c2-11590f124dd8.csv" train_file <- "../../data/training.csv" if(!file.exists(train_file)){ download.file(training_data_url, train_file, method = "curl") } test_data_url <- "https://s3.amazonaws.com/drivendata/data/2/public/5c9fa979-5a84-45d6-93b9-543d1a0efc41.csv" test_file <- "../../data/test.csv" if(!file.exists(test_file)){ download.file(test_data_url, test_file, method = "curl") } Looking at the first few rows of data training <- read.csv("../../data/training.csv", row.names = 1) head(training) ## Months.since.Last.Donation Number.of.Donations ## 619 2 50 ## 664 0 13 ## 441 1 16 ## 160 2 20 ## 358 1 24 ## 335 4 4 ## Total.
